summary: Tested force password change for new users and Sentiment Analysis Network Error fix. All features working correctly. Backend endpoints validated with pytest (11/11 passed). Frontend pages tested with Playwright - set-password page loads correctly with URL params, login flow works, and Sentiment Analysis completes without Network Error.
passed_tests: POST /api/v1/auth/set-initial-password - returns 401 for wrong temporary password
POST /api/v1/auth/set-initial-password - returns 400 if password change not required
POST /api/v1/auth/login - returns success without must_change_password for normal users
POST /api/v1/sentiment/analyze - analyzes URLs without Network Error
Frontend: Set-password page loads with email from URL params
Frontend: Set-password page shows password requirements checklist
Frontend: Set-password page has password strength indicator
Frontend: Login page TechCorp demo buttons work
Frontend: Sentiment Analysis page loads correctly
Frontend: Sentiment Analysis URL input and Add button work
Frontend: Sentiment Analysis completes without Network Error
Frontend: Sentiment Analysis shows results with score and insights
critical_code_review_comments: auth.py: set_initial_password endpoint (lines 1120-1190) properly validates temp password, must_change_password flag, and password strength
login endpoint (lines 420-430) correctly checks must_change_password flag and returns appropriate response for frontend redirect
set-password/page.jsx: Well-implemented with Suspense wrapper, URL params handling, password strength indicator, and requirements checklist
sentiment-analysis/page.jsx: Now uses authenticated api from @/lib/api instead of direct axios, fixing the Network Error issue
AuthContext.jsx: PUBLIC_PATHS correctly includes /contentry/auth/set-password to allow unauthenticated access
seed_data_creation: None - used existing TechCorp demo data
context_for_next_testing_agent: Force password change flow: When login returns must_change_password:true, frontend redirects to /contentry/auth/set-password with email and name params. The set-password page is in PUBLIC_PATHS so it doesn't require auth. Sentiment Analysis now uses authenticated api instance from @/lib/api which includes withCredentials:true for HttpOnly cookie auth - this fixed the Network Error that occurred when using direct axios without credentials.
